title: Cognitive Load Theory-Based Project Design: Advanced Social Education Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic educational theory, understanding of social studies content, and project-based learning experience
context.additional_context: Personalized content delivery and collaborative tool integration through individual device utilization

learning_goals: Learners can apply three metrics (e.g., cognitive activity complexity, visual element arrangement, information processing stages) to measure working memory load when designing social studies curricula.

Learners create project designs applying modular content segmentation (≥3 independent modules) and incremental integration strategies (≥2-stage processes) to promote schema automation, achieving ≥80% fulfillment in peer evaluations and instructor feedback.
Learners successfully implement (over 80%) cognitive load reduction measures (e.g., visual aids, information chunking) through peer feedback in PBL environments
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
